meanings.definition: A sheet of microfilm containing microphotographs of the pages of a newspaper, catalog, or other document.
meanings.sent1: I found old newspapers on microfiches at the library.
meanings.sent2: The library keeps historical documents on microfiches for easy access.
meanings.sent3: Looking through the tiny pictures on the microfiches felt like exploring a miniature world.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like scattered microfiches, each holding a piece of the past.
meanings.sent5: The microfiches revealed a hidden story waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To store or archive documents on microfiche.
meanings.sent1: We need to microfiche these important papers for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to microfiche all the records for better organization.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could microfiche his messy desk to declutter it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to microfiche memories, neatly storing them away.
meanings.sent5: The professor taught us how to microfiche documents efficiently.
